channel.title: Java, Binary encryption? (Crypter)
channel.description:
I don't know if I have the terminology correct, but this is essentially what I'm trying to do. For example, a file has a binary value, I'm looking to take that value, encrypt and apply the encryption to a new file.
I've messed about with some cryptography in .net and got some basic encryption but I'm not sure how I'd go about this.
Any suggestions?

item.title: Java, Binary encryption? (Crypter)
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

imthenull:

how exactly are you xor’ing the data? how are you saving it?

I’m just writing it back to the file :x. Does it have to be packed back up properly? If so, how would I go about it?

And the xor encryption I pulled off an example

item.title: Java, Binary encryption? (Crypter)
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

imthenull:

Cryptography is very easy (at least basic ciphering). You basically load a file into memory with an InputStream, a FileInputStream to be specific. From there you will want to mutate the data with a cipher of some sort, afterwards, I would personally apply some sort of compression to the mutated data. Now all you need to do it use a FileOutputStream to write the mutated data to the disk. Pretty easy huh?

Hey, I’ve got a file system set up where it reads all the bytes of a certain file, and then re-writes them to another one and it seems to work fine so far. Struggling with encrypting it and then writing it back though. I’m using xor encryption if it helps.

Edit: The encryption seems to be rendering the file corrupt when I’m trying to open it after writing back. It’s definitely the encryption because I tried to write back without and it works fine like the original one does.

Read full topic

item.title: Java, Binary encryption? (Crypter)
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

Try encrypting the Java bytecode so it can’t be decompiled.
